title: Job Openings at Talent Lab Limited
content:
Talent Lab Limited - Our clients in various sectors are currently recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the following positions below:

1.) Bid Response Officer

Job Location: Gbagada, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: Procurement Manager

Job Overview
     

            
    




	The Bid Response Officer will be responsible for the development, and submission of Requests for Proposals (RFPs), Requests for Information (RFIs), and other formal tenders.
	This role will collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the company's bids are competitive, accurate, and align with client requirements.


Key Responsibilities
Bid Preparation and Submission:


	Lead the development of bid responses, ensuring compliance with the client’s specifications and requirements.
	Prepare high-quality, persuasive, and well-organized proposals that highlight the company’s strengths and solutions.
	Coordinate with internal teams to gather necessary information for the bid response.
	Review and ensure the bid complies with all legal, financial, and technical terms before submission.
	Ensure timely submission of bids in accordance with deadlines.


Documentation and Content Management:


	Maintain and update a repository of standard responses, case studies, and other supporting materials to improve the efficiency of bid responses.
	Ensure all bid-related documents are properly formatted, consistent, and accurately reflect the company’s offerings and capabilities.
	Collaborate with various departments to continuously improve the quality of content and ensure alignment with the organization’s strategic goals.


Client Liaison:


	Liaise with clients to clarify tender specifications, discuss bid requirements, and ensure any special conditions or client needs are addressed.
	Address any queries or requests from clients regarding the bid response during the evaluation process.


Compliance and Quality Assurance:


	Ensure all bid documents are compliant with industry standards, client requirements, and internal policies.
	Conduct internal reviews of bid documents to ensure quality, accuracy, and consistency.
	Track the progress of bids and ensure that all deadlines are met without compromising quality.


Qualifications / Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or related field (or equivalent experience).
	Proven experience in bid preparation, proposal writing, or related roles (typically 2-3 years).
	Strong written and verbal communication skills.
	High attention to detail and the ability to work under tight deadlines.
	Excellent organizational and project management abilities.
	Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
	Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), as well as proposal management software
	Analytical mindset with the ability to assess and mitigate risks in proposals.
	Knowledge of tendering processes, RFP requirements, and procurement procedures.
	Experience in client relationship management.
	Familiarity with CRM software or platforms


Salary
N220,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 5th August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitments@talentlabltd.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note:


	Our client is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive workplace. We up hold a strict non-discrimination policy, ensuring fair treatment of all applicants and employees, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, national or ethnic origin, age, marital status, genetic information, or any other protected characteristic under applicable laws.


 

 

2.) Finance Analyst

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time / Onsite
Reports To: Head, Corporate Finance

Job Overview


	The Financial Analyst supports the Corporate Finance team in evaluating investment opportunities, developing financial models, conducting due diligence, and delivering strategic insights across private equity and project finance portfolios.
	This role also plays a key part in ensuring compliance with internal controls, risk management policies, and regulatory frameworks


Job Responsibilities
Investment Evaluation & Due Diligence:


	Assist in the review and analysis of new investment opportunities, including financial, commercial, and operational assessments.
	Support the due diligence process by gathering and validating data, identifying risks, and contributing to investment memos and presentations.
	Conduct market research and benchmarking analysis to support investment decisions.


Financial Modelling & Analysis:


	Build, update, and maintain robust financial models for valuation, scenario planning, and return analysis.
	Support stress testing, cash flow forecasting, and financial projections for both new and existing investments.
	Analyze portfolio company performance and provide recommendations for value optimization.


Strategic Insights & Portfolio Support:


	Generate reports and dashboards that provide actionable insights to the Head of Corporate Finance and other stakeholders.
	Monitor industry trends, competitor performance, and macroeconomic indicators relevant to portfolio performance.
	Assist in developing pitch materials, investor reports, and board-level presentations.


Risk & Compliance:


	Support the implementation of internal controls, financial governance, and compliance frameworks.
	Identify and escalate potential financial or operational risks during analysis and due diligence.
	Ensure alignment with regulatory standards, corporate policies, and audit requirements.


Required Skills and Qualifications
Education and Experience:


	Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field is required.
	2–3 years of experience in financial analysis, investment banking, corporate finance, or private equity.
	Relevant certifications such as CFA Level I or ACCA in progress/completed is an advantage.
	Proficiency in Excel-based financial modelling, valuation techniques, and data analysis tools.


Core competencies:


	Strong leadership and team development skills
	Excellent analytical and financial modelling capabilities
	Deep understanding of capital markets, financial instruments, and investment vehicles
	Exceptional stakeholder engagement and negotiation skills
	Strong ethical compass and commitment to corporate governance


Diversity, equity, and inclusion statement:


	Our client is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive workplace. We uphold a strict non-discrimination policy, ensuring fair treatment of all applicants and employees, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, national or ethnic origin, age, marital status, genetic information, or any other protected characteristic under applicable laws.


Salary
N350,000ngn - N400,000 / month.

Application Closing Date: 1st August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitments@talentlabltd.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Please do not apply if you do not currently reside within Abuja.

 

 

3.) Business Developer

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Our client is seeking a dynamic and commercially minded Business Developer with a strong background in Quantity Surveying to lead growth initiatives in the construction and oil & gas sectors.
	This unique hybrid role blends technical expertise in tendering and cost management with strategic business development, offering an exceptional opportunity for a results-driven professional ready to shape and secure high-value projects.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and develop new business opportunities in the construction and oil & gas sectors.
	Prepare, review, and package competitive tenders and bids, ensuring compliance with client specifications and industry standards.
	Lead commercial negotiations and support contract discussions with prospective clients and partners.
	Collaborate with technical and operational teams to develop winning strategies for project acquisition.
	Monitor market trends, competitor activity, and client needs to tailor proposals and business outreach.
	Maintain strong relationships with clients, stakeholders, and industry professionals.


Requirements


	Degree in Quantity Surveying, Construction Management, or related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in tendering, bidding, or cost estimation— ideally within the construction and/or oil & gas industries.
	Proven track record in developing and securing projects through successful tender submissions.
	Strong commercial acumen and negotiation skills.
	Excellent communication, presentation, and stakeholder management abilities.
	Self-motivated, with a strategic mindset and a passion for growth.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary
	Performance-based incentives
	A supportive, growth-oriented team environment
	Career progression and professional development


Application Closing Date: 20th August, 2025.

title: Job Openings at Jamub Group
content:
Jamub Group is a conglomerate of different companies duly registered in line with relevant laws of the Federal Republic of Nigeria, the attribute of which makes us a non-cyclical organisation. Established to deliver solutions in the various areas of our business interests, our delivery model spans Business to Business (B2B), Business to Government (B2G) and Business to Consumer (B2C) in the economic value chain with a range of products and services which cut across the industries.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Quantity Surveyor

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are looking for a proactive and detail-oriented Quantity Surveyor to oversee the contractual and financial aspects of construction projects.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for cost planning, contract management, procurement processes, and ensuring that projects are delivered on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards.


Responsibilities


	Preparing cost estimates and budgets for projects at various stages of design.
	Performing cost control and financial reporting throughout the project lifecycle.
	Reviewing and assessing tenders and contracts.
	Monitoring project progress and measuring variations.
	Evaluating and negotiating subcontractor and supplier quotes.
	Preparing and issuing progress claims, variation orders, and final accounts.
	Conducting risk, value management, and cost control processes.
	Providing advice on contractual claims and procurement strategies.
	Liaising with clients, consultants, contractors, and internal teams.
	Proper utilisation of human resources as well as materials.


Requirements


	HND / Degree in Quantity Surveying or its equivalent
	Having a proven work experience of over 4 - 7 years in real estate and road construction.
	Must be duly certified by a professional regulatory body
	Good knowledge of cost accounting or cost management
	Strong managerial skills
	Good communication skills
	Ethical and diligent towards work
	Strong negotiation skills.


Application Closing Date: 11th August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: jobs@jamubgroup.com using "Quantity Surveyor" as subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Internal Control and Audit Officer

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)

Job Summary


	The Internal Control and Audit Officer is responsible for evaluating and improving the effectiveness of internal controls, risk management, and governance processes within the organization.
	This role involves conducting audits, analysing business processes, and ensuring compliance with internal policies and external regulations.
	The role requires a thorough understanding of financial reporting, risk assessment, and process improvement.


Responsibilities


	Conduct periodic risk assessment to identify operational and financial risks and recommend risk-mitigating measures.
	Identify gaps and recommend internal control measures, including to appraise the adequacy of control systems.
	Ensure protection of the organization’s assets against fraud and theft.
	Verify the accuracy of financial statements, reports, accounting system.
	Ensure compliance to regulatory requirements, corporate policies and procedures.
	Investigate identified and reported cases, including following up to ensure timely resolution.
	Prepare audit reports and communicate findings in a timely manner.
	Verify the validity and certainty of goal achievement.
	Participate in the development and implementation a detailed audit plan.
	Recommend or provide requisite guidance on control for effectiveness and efficiency of operations.
	Other responsibilities as assigned.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Accounting, Finance, Economics or relevant field.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in a similar position.
	Professional certification (ICAN, ACCA, CIA) is an added advantage.
	In-depth understanding of accounting and auditing standards.
	Commitment to ethical standards and high level of personal and professional integrity.
	Proactive approach to problem-solving.
	Professional level verbal and written communication with good report writing and presentation skills.
	Hands on experience with relevant software and proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.
	Strong analytical skills with attention to detail.
	Ability to maintain objective view and confidentiality.
	Ability to handle multiple tasks in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
	Ability to work independently with little or no supervision.
	Good interpersonal and organizational skills.


Application Closing Date: 11th August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@jamubgroup.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Tractor Operator

Job Location: Kogi
Employment Type: Part-time

Job Summary


	The Tractor Operator is responsible for operating and maintaining tractors and associated farm or construction machinery to perform tasks such as plowing, harrowing, planting, hauling, grading, or clearing land.
	The role ensures timely execution of field operations while adhering to safety, mechanical, and environmental standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Operate tractors and related attachments (plows, harrows, trailers, mowers, graders, etc.) efficiently and safely.
	Transport goods, equipment, or materials within and outside the site.
	Perform basic maintenance checks on tractors before and after use (oil, fuel, hydraulics, tire pressure).
	Comply with environmental and safety regulations in the operation and handling of machinery.
	Assist with loading and unloading of materials.
	Keep accurate records of hours worked and tasks completed.
	Report mechanical faults promptly to the maintenance team or supervisor.
	Ensure safe operation around people, animals, and property.
	Follow assigned routes, schedules, and work orders.
	Participate in training or safety briefings when required.


Qualifications and Experience


	Minimum of SSCE/WAEC or equivalent.
	Proven experience (2+ years preferred) as a tractor operator or similar heavy machinery operator.
	Valid driver’s license and/or tractor operating certificate (where applicable).
	Knowledge of tractor mechanics and routine servicing.


Application Closing Date: 11th August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@jamubgroup.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

4.) Procurement Officer

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)

Job Summary


	The Procurement Officer is responsible for managing the organization’s purchasing activities, ensuring the efficient acquisition of goods and services in a timely and cost-effective manner.
	The role ensures compliance with internal procurement policies, vendor management, and contract negotiation while maintaining quality standards and supporting operational objectives.


Key Responsibilities


	Source and evaluate reliable suppliers and vendors based on price, quality, service, and delivery capabilities.
	Prepare and process purchase orders in accordance with company policies and procedures.
	Liaise with internal departments to determine procurement needs, quality specifications, and delivery timelines.
	Maintain an up-to-date procurement database, including supplier information, purchase history, and pricing.
	Track and report key functional metrics to reduce expenses and improve effectiveness.
	Ensure proper documentation, approval, and compliance with procurement policies and relevant regulatory requirements.
	Monitor inventory levels and reorder supplies to avoid shortages and production delays.
	Conduct market research to keep abreast of market trends, pricing, and availability of goods.
	Negotiate contracts, terms, and pricing with suppliers to obtain the best possible deals.
	Resolve any supply issues or discrepancies in a timely and professional manner.
	Coordinate with the finance department on invoice processing and payment reconciliation.
	Prepare and present regular procurement reports to management.


Key Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Purchasing & Supply, Civil Engineering, Quantity Surveying, Business Administration, Economics, Logistics, or a related field.
	Minimum of 7years of relevant experience in procurement or supply chain management, preferably in Civil Construction.
	Professional certification (e.g, CIPS, NIPSM, or related) is an added advantage.
	Solid knowledge of procurement policies, vendor sourcing, and contract management.
	Excellent negotiation and communication skills.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
	Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, Outlook) and procurement software
	High level of integrity and attention to detail.
	Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple tasks efficiently.


Application Closing Date: 5th August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@jamubgroup.com using the Job Postion as the subject of the mail.

        Tecon Oil Services Limited is a wholly indigenous company that originated as an Isle of Man-based entity under the control of an American Investor group through Alliance Oil of Houston, Texas. Tecon has established itself as a prominent player in the field of Oilfield Equipment Rentals, offering specialized services such as Oil Well Fishing, Casing and Tubing Running, Oil Well Snubbing/Hydraulic Workover Services, Machine shop/Tool fabrication, and Redressing, among others.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: Torque Turn Engineer

Job Location: Rivers
Employment Type: Full Time

Responsibilities


	Operate and monitor torque-turn equipment
	Record and report torque-turn data


Qualifications


	Engineering background preferred
	3+ years of experience in torque turn operations.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: stephanie.arizuma@teconoilserv.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
